snippet: The New York officer, Michael Carsey, was convicted on Thursday of lying under oath and filing false information to obtain a search warrant.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Michael Carsey is convicted of lying under oath and filing false information to obtain a search warrant, the second conviction in what prosecutors describe as a scheme to cover up illegal vehicle searches; Carsey faces up to seven years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The New York officer, Michael Carsey, was convicted on Thursday of lying under oath and filing false information to obtain a search warrant.

headline.seo: Police Officer Is Convicted of Perjury to Get a Search Warrant
headline.main: Police Officer Guilty of Falsifying Information
